page.title: 15Cuckney Home Life pre 1914
page.content: There wasn't any water inside the houses.There were several pumps in the village so the water had to be transported.Zinc baths were placed in the front room for the family bathing. People used earth closets which were holes dug in the ground.Each member of the family had his own toilet complete with a white wooden seat which was scrubbed 2 or 3 times a week.Homes were lit by paraffin lamps or candles. Mr Dearnley was one of the first to put a chemical toilet in a house.Most families grew their own vegetables which were sown every year on Good Friday.Each family kept hens and at least 2 pigs for food for the year. Children helped with the gardening and any other household duties.They played with whips and tops or sticks and hoops.There were occasional village dances for adults.
